body_html: I see. It's probably model-dependent. For reference I was running a model similar to the one from Action-Conditional Video Prediction using Deep Networks in Atari Games. If I set torch.backends.cudnn.enabled = False the training time is about twice as long; if instead I set torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic = True the time difference is within 1%. I'll certainly keep the speed concern in mind when I run other models. Thanks.

body: I see. It's probably model-dependent. For reference I was running a model similar to the one from [Action-Conditional Video Prediction using Deep Networks in Atari Games](https://arxiv.org/abs/1507.08750). If I set `torch.backends.cudnn.enabled = False` the training time is about twice as long; if instead I set `torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic = True` the time difference is within 1%. I'll certainly keep the speed concern in mind when I run other models. Thanks.
